info.title: Weatherbit.io - Weather API
info.description: This is the documentation for the Weatherbit API.  The base URL for the API is [http://api.weatherbit.io/v1.0/](http://api.weatherbit.io/v1.0/) (Free/Paid accounts) or [https://api.weatherbit.io/v1.0/](http://api.weatherbit.io/v1.0/) (Paid accounts). Below is the Swagger UI documentation for the API. All API requests require the `key` parameter.        An Example for a 5 day forecast for London, GB would be `http://api.weatherbit.io/v1.0/forecast/3hourly/geosearch?city=London`&`country=GB`

get.summary: Returns a daily forecast - Given Lat/Lon.
get.description: (REQUIRED: Developer Plan or Higher) Returns a daily forecast, where each point represents one day (24hr) period. Every point has a datetime string in the format "YYYY-MM-DD". One day begins at 00:00 UTC, and ends at 23:59 UTC.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days to return - Default 16.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Convert to units - Default Metric (Options - I = Imperial, S = Scientific)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

get.summary: Returns a daily forecast - Given City and/or State, Country.
get.description: (REQUIRED: Developer Plan or Higher) Returns a daily forecast, where each point represents one day (24hr) period. Every point has a datetime string in the format "YYYY-MM-DD". One day begins at 00:00 UTC, and ends at 23:59 UTC. Accepts a city in the format of City,ST or City. The state, and country parameters can be provided to make the search more accurate.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days to return - Default 16.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Convert to units - Default Metric (Options - I = Imperial, S = Scientific)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

get.summary: Returns a daily forecast - Given an IP Address, or ip=auto for automatic IP lookup.
get.description: (REQUIRED: Developer Plan or Higher) Returns a daily forecast, where each point represents one day (24hr) period. Every point has a datetime string in the format "YYYY-MM-DD". One day begins at 00:00 UTC, and ends at 23:59 UTC. Accepts a city in the format of City,ST or City. The state, and country parameters can be provided to make the search more accurate.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days to return - Default 16.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Convert to units - Default Metric (Options - I = Imperial, S = Scientific)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

One day begins at 00:00 UTC, and ends at 23:59 UTC. Accepts a city in the format of City,ST or City. The state, and country parameters can be provided to make the search more accurate.

get.summary: Returns a hourly forecast - Given a lat/lon.
get.description: (REQUIRED: Developer Plan or Higher) Returns an hourly forecast, where each point represents a one hour period. Every point has a datetime string in the format "YYYY-MM-DD:HH". Time is UTC.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Convert to units - Default Metric (Options - I = Imperial, S = Scientific)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

get.summary: Returns an Geolocation object.
get.description: (Paid Plans only) Returns a geolocation object. Given an IP address. If no IP supplied, will use request IP address.

get.description: (REQUIRED: Advanced Plan or Higher) Returns a group of Current Observations - Given a list of Station Call IDs.

parameters.description: Comma separated list of Station Call ID's. Example - KRDU, KBFI, KVNY

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Convert to units - Default Metric (Options - I = Imperial, S = Scientific)

parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

parameters.name: units

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Wraps return in jsonp callback - Example - callback=func

datetime.description: Date in format "YYYY-MM-DD:HH" for non-daily. "YYYY-MM-DD" for Daily. All datetime is in (UTC).

snow.description: Accumulated snowfall since last forecast point. Default millimeters.

snow6h.description: 6 hour accumulated snowfall (Not found in Daily Forecast). Default millimeters.

precip.description: Accumulated precipitation since last forecast point. Default millimeters.

precip6h.description: Accumulated precipitation since last forecast point(Not found in Daily Forecast). Default millimeters.

temp.description: Temperature (In daily forecast, this is average temperature over course of day). Default Celcius.

max_temp.description: Maximum daily Temperature (Daily only). Default Celcius.

min_temp.description: Minimum daily Temperature (Daily only). Default Celcius.

icon.description: Icon code for forecast image display.

datetime.description: Date in format "YYYY-MM-DD:HH" for non-daily. "YYYY-MM-DD" for Daily. All datetime is in (UTC).

icon.description: Icon code for forecast image display.

estimated.description: Object keyed by parameter, and the estimation algorithm used to derive a missing value. N= Nearest Neighbor, I=Intepolation.

organization.example: AS11426 Time Warner Cable Internet LLC

icon.description: Icon code for forecast image display.

slp.description: Mean sea level pressure in millibars (mb).
